Optimize SkipList flush by Sync thread to check if mem-table entry after sync-logMarker, which indicates the target checkpoint position. SkipList is augmented to capture last rolled-logMarker before inserting any entry, to indicate all entries are added after rolled log Marker (aka checkpoint). The sync thread simply move sync-logMarker on timeout or shutdown for checkpoint position, which allows SkipList size limit and sync-interval settings factored in the tuning.

Add thread pool to process callback to offload Journal forcewrite thread, which is shown impacting group-commit throughput. The number of threads is 1 + number of writers, with one of the thread as dispatcher thread from time to time and also serving callbacks.

Add start sequence id for active ledger range, to handle scenerio of closed ledgers GCed before active ledger deliveried messages to clients. In between, the topic go thru recovery either due to topic transfer or hub restart. The topic metadata recorded in ZK does not track enough information to calculate the start sequence id for the active ledger. The problem was the calculation made assumption that the active ledger is the only ledger ever introduced for the topic. Refer to Bookkeeper BOOKKEEPER-439 for more context.
